Story: When SecDef Mattis lands in Seoul, he can tout "new" weapon sales to Korea. https://t.co/lxinHeygoh https://t.co/xTOhbtqdDD
With SecDef Mattis en route to Seoul, State Department just ok'd $140m worth of arms for South Korea.

@collinkrum same! Gonna need some dedicated spotters with long cameras to hang out around Palmdale.
@FG_STrim we've been assuming b21 is smaller wingspan, right? Or is that just me?
@collinkrum thanks, but wish I had more. Frustrating covering B21 because we'll know so little about it for years.
RQ-4 has a 130.9 ft wingspan and is 47.6 ft long. Relevant to gauge B-21 size? Maybe! I have no idea. https://t.co/a9MxwS120m
@FG_STrim the things you know.
@collinkrum unclear. My gut tells me they are going to need a new structure, though. Why try to work around outdated one?
Of note: contract specifies the facility has to be done by end 2019. Which means B21s get stealth coated in 2020. https://t.co/KsnKnSXJwR
@northkoreafront frankly I don't think Northrop knows yet, either.
@northkoreafront we don't know! My guess is it is more advanced, but how the upkeep has changed I don't have a clue.

In other words: win T-X, and you corner the Western market on trainer aircraft for the next four decades. Lose and… https://t.co/eX7J5Ac91x
Why does it matter? The T-X trainer competition will replace 350 USAF trainers right away. Expectation is 700+ worl… https://t.co/y6Wujgh5Gr

@Figarella @TheBaseLeg haha thanks! It's down to Boeing's clean sheet and Lockheed/KIA T-50. (Technically Sierra nevada is involved too.)
BREAKING: Northrop/BAE drops out of T-X program. Story soon. Wow.
